content: Which famous playwright wrote the tragedy "Romeo and Juliet" about two star-crossed lovers from feuding families?

Oh, that's a classic! The famous playwright who wrote "Romeo and Juliet" is William Shakespeare. It's one of his most well-known works, and it tells the story of two young lovers from rival families in Verona, Italy, whose love is forbidden and ultimately leads to their tragic deaths. The play explores themes of love, hate, and the consequences of feuding. It's fascinating how Shakespeare's works continue to resonate with people even after centuries!
